intro: Agarista calliopsidea, commonly known as the narrowleaf agarista, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. Agarista calliopsidea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
